Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Mature Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with faded lotus flower in added white outline and added red centre; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of head, spotted ears and neck of perhaps a hare, to right.
Curator's comments: Hares rarely feature on Chian fine wares. There are perhaps only two examples from Naukratis; see also British Museum 1888,0401.477.d. Lemos places this sherd in the Wild Goat Style, but the interior decoration suggests that it is later, most likely in the Mature Animal Style. The small size of the sherd accounts for the lack of filling ornament.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 241, no. 215)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0505) (phase 2)
